## Description {#details}

This is the common base class of value handles.

ValueHandle&#39;s are smart pointers to <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a>&#39;s that have special behavior when the value is deleted or ReplaceAllUsesWith&#39;d. See the specific handles below for details.

Definition at line 29 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/valuehandle-h">ValueHandle.h</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Enumerations

### enum  {#ae2f1a12c55f1c06acc38407b8627cb4d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="enum llvm::ValueHandleBase::HandleBaseKind "
 labels = {["protected"]}>
This indicates what sub class the handle actually is.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="ae2f1a12c55f1c06acc38407b8627cb4da4d4e25f8ba89be14c9c2d60082bb7516" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Assert">

</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae2f1a12c55f1c06acc38407b8627cb4da670860d51b165a2d146356622a256418" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Callback">

</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae2f1a12c55f1c06acc38407b8627cb4da3c970eedf4f533d381b99e2b5c73ad77" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Weak">

</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="ae2f1a12c55f1c06acc38407b8627cb4dad057ff89faba8a9c0566aabcbf3f8fce" />
<EnumerationListItem name="WeakTracking">

</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

This is to avoid having a vtable for the light-weight handle pointers. The fully general Callback version does have a vtable.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/valuehandle-h/#l00037">37</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/valuehandle-h">ValueHandle.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

## Protected Member Functions

### clearValPtr() {#a9891c6c9a198a9c5c33608be4cd84782}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void llvm::ValueHandleBase::clearValPtr ()"
  labels = {["inline", "protected"]}>
Clear the underlying pointer without clearing the use list.

This should only be used if a derived class has manually removed the handle from the use list.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/valuehandle-h/#l00114">114</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/valuehandle-h">ValueHandle.h</a>.

### AddToExistingUseList() {#a80e1369ad793d973102200658765e81d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void ValueHandleBase::AddToExistingUseList (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/valuehandlebase">ValueHandleBase</a> &#42;&#42; List)</>}>
Add this ValueHandle to the use list for V.

List is the address of either the head of the list or a Next node within the existing use list.
